intro: Caucalis latifolia var. multiflora, commonly known as the broad-leaved caucalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of broad, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. It is a perennial herb that thrives in temperate climates and is noted for its aromatic foliage. The flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, making it an important plant in ecological gardens.
